attributes.additional_details: I and many other local people have contacted the council to bring the attention to the road surfaces in our area. Just covering a pothole is not a long term repair, this later worsens as rain seeps through and travels damaging a larger surface than what we had started with.
attributes.background: My street has worn down to its bricks. There are potholes and temporary fixes everywhere, which need refilling every few times a month. The weather and temporary fixes have damaged the roads to beyond minor repairs. This needs serious attention and immediate action.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
